sections.title: Getting Started
sections.content:
## Setting Up Clara

Clara requires two main components to function:

### 1. Ollama (Required for AI Chat)

1. Visit [Ollama's official website](https://ollama.com)
2. Download and install Ollama for your operating system
3. After installation, Ollama will run in the background
4. No additional configuration is needed

### 2. ComfyUI (Required for Image Generation)

1. Visit [ComfyUI's website](https://www.comfy.org/download)
2. Follow the installation instructions for your platform
3. Start ComfyUI before using Clara's image generation features

### First Steps

1. Complete the onboarding process
2. Configure your API endpoints in Settings
3. Download your preferred AI models using the Model Manager

### ComfyUI Node Issues
If you encounter errors like 'LoRA Stacker does not exist' or have issues with image generation, install these required repositories:

1. [Acly's ComfyUI Tooling Nodes](https://github.com/Acly/comfyui-tooling-nodes)
2. [Jags111's Efficiency Nodes](https://github.com/jags111/efficiency-nodes-comfyui)

Follow the installation instructions in each repository.

### Multiple VAEs and LoRAs
- Currently, stacking multiple LoRAs is disabled
- Future updates will enable this feature

### Image Support & Models
1. Go to Assistant Settings
2. Find your model in the list
3. Enable 'Image Support' toggle
4. Models like Gemma3 and Minicpm2.6 will now work with images

### Image Generation & Prompting
- Use the Image Generation feature to create custom images
- Import pre-made workflows from [ClaraVerse](https://github.com/badboysm890/ClaraVerse)

### Upcoming Features
- Enhanced prompt generation
- Automatic parameter configuration
- Community tab for sharing content

sections.title: Features Overview
sections.content:
## Clara's Main Features

### 1. AI Chat Assistant
- Multiple local model support (LLaMA, Mistral, etc.)
- Image understanding capabilities
- Streaming and context-aware conversations
- System prompt and persona customization
- Local-first inference via Ollama

### 2. Image Generation
- Text-to-image generation using Stable Diffusion
- Support for ControlNet, LoRA, and VAE
- Image editing and remixing capabilities
- Model management with prompt presets

### 3. Local Model Management (Coming Soon)
- Download, switch, and manage local models in-app
- Automatically detect available Ollama models
- Support for OpenAI-compatible backends in future

### 4. Privacy & Offline-First
- Runs fully on macOS, Windows, and Linux
- No data leaves your device
- Zero tracking or telemetry

sections.title: Tips & Tricks
sections.content:
## Maximizing Clara's Potential

### Chat Assistant Tips
- Use clear, specific prompts
- Utilize system messages to set tone or behavior
- Take advantage of image understanding
- Save useful conversations for reuse

### Image Generation Tips
- Be descriptive with prompts
- Use negative prompts to refine outputs
- Mix models and try different styles
- Save successful settings as templates

sections.title: Common Issues & Solutions
sections.content:
## Common Issues & Solutions

### ComfyUI Node Issues
If you encounter errors like 'LoRA Stacker does not exist' or have issues with image generation, install these required repositories:

1. [Acly's ComfyUI Tooling Nodes](https://github.com/Acly/comfyui-tooling-nodes)
2. [Jags111's Efficiency Nodes](https://github.com/jags111/efficiency-nodes-comfyui)

### Multiple VAEs and LoRAs
- Currently, stacking multiple LoRAs is disabled
- This feature will be added in future updates

### Image Support & Models
- Go to Assistant Settings
- Enable 'Image Support' for supported models
- Models like Gemma3, Minicpm2.6 will then support image input

### Image Generation Issues
- Make sure ComfyUI is running before launching image tools
- Use the latest ClaraVerse workflows to avoid missing node issues

### General Troubleshooting
- Restart Clara after changing settings
- Ensure backend tools (Ollama/ComfyUI) are active
- Check logs via debug mode if something breaks

### Support
- Open an issue on GitHub
- Join the community Discord (link in README)
- Check [ClaraVerse](https://github.com/badboysm890/ClaraVerse) for updated content
